  • Element
org.drombler.acp.core.docking

Annotation Type ViewDocking


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=SOURCE)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface ViewDocking
    Registers an view dockable.

    Views are singleton dockables.
    Author:
    puce

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String areaId
      The Docking Area ID to which this view should be docked.
      String displayName
      The text to be displayed, e.g. as the text for tabs or menu items.
      WindowMenuEntry menuEntry
      The menu entry to open this view.
      int position
      The position to order the views in a Docking Area.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String accelerator
      The accelerator key combination to open this view.
      String icon
      The icon name pattern to resolve the icons to be used for this view.
      String resourceBundleBaseName
      The ResourceBundle base name.
      DockingState state
      The initial docking state.

    • Element Detail

      • areaId

        public abstract String areaId
        The Docking Area ID to which this view should be docked.
        Returns:
        the Docking Area ID to which this view should be docked
        See Also:
        DockingArea.id()

      • position

        public abstract int position
        The position to order the views in a Docking Area.

        It's a best practice to leave out some positions between entries to allow other bundles to register entries between some existing ones.
        Returns:
        the position to order the views in a Docking Area

      • displayName

        public abstract String displayName
        The text to be displayed, e.g. as the text for tabs or menu items.

        If the value starts with '%' the rest of the value is interpreted as a property key and the value gets looked-up in the resource bundle.
        Returns:
        the text to be displayed for this view
        See Also:
        resourceBundleBaseName()

      • menuEntry

        public abstract WindowMenuEntry menuEntry
        The menu entry to open this view.
        Returns:
        the menu entry to open this view

      • accelerator

        public abstract String accelerator
        The accelerator key combination to open this view.

        If the value starts with '%' the rest of the value is interpreted as a property key and the value gets looked-up in the resource bundle.
        Returns:
        the accelerator key combination to open this view
        Default:
        ""

      • icon

        public abstract String icon
        The icon name pattern to resolve the icons to be used for this view.

        Note that this only specifies the name pattern. Drombler ACP looks for <icon-base-name>16.<icon-extension> for tabs and menu items (expected to be 16x16 pixels) and <icon-base-name>24.<icon-extension> for toolbar buttons (expected to be 24x24 pixels). So if icon is "test.png", Drombler ACP would look for test16.png (for tabs and menu items) and test24.png (for toolbar buttons).
        Returns:
        the icon name pattern
        Default:
        ""

      • state

        public abstract DockingState state
        The initial docking state. Currently this has no effect, but might be supported in a future version.
        Returns:
        the initial docking state
        Default:
        org.drombler.acp.core.docking.DockingState.DOCKED

      • resourceBundleBaseName

        public abstract String resourceBundleBaseName
        The ResourceBundle base name.

        • If resourceBundleBaseName is empty, a ResourceBundle will be looked up which is in the same package as the annotated view and has a base name equal to the simple name of the annotated view.
        • If resourceBundleBaseName equals 'Bundle', the package ResourceBundle gets looked up.
        • Else a ResourceBundle for the resourceBundleBaseName gets looked up using the same ClassLoader as the annotated view.
        Returns:
        the base name of the ResourceBundle, 'Bundle' (for the package ResourceBundle) or empty (for the class ResourceBundle).
        See Also:
        ResourceBundleUtils.PACKAGE_RESOURCE_BUNDLE_BASE_NAME, ResourceBundleUtils.getConditionalResourceBundle(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String)
        Default:
        ""
